testim.a: He's very reliable, works fast, and delivers high-quality results. Definitely worth the price.
testim.b: We were stuck on a critical issue for weeks, and he solved it in a matter of hours. Super sharp and easy to work with.
testim.c: Working with him felt like having an extra team member who truly cared. Great communication, no fluff, and real results.

HeroSection.subtitle: Dedicated to transforming complex ideas into effective solutions

ProjectsSection.title: Featured Projects
ProjectsSection.pc: Hover over the cards to see them in color!
ProjectsSection.mobile: Hold in the pictures to see them in color!

mercadolibrepricechart.name: Cinemax
mercadolibrepricechart.description: AI-powered platform for booking movie tickets.
mercadolibrepricechart.about:
Cinemax is a web application that simplifies movie ticket booking with an intuitive design. 
Its backend, developed from scratch, ensures secure and reliable performance. 
Additionally, it features an advanced AI assistant to help users throughout the booking process and address any questions they may have.

monedasAPI.name: BlinkLink
monedasAPI.description: Robust API for URL shortening, leveraging CRUD operations.
monedasAPI.about:
With the goal of delving deeper into API development and database management, I developed BlinkLink, a public API that provides an advanced URL shortening service. 

BlinkLink is designed to provide efficient and scalable performance, integrating CRUD operations that enable complete and secure link management.

TheDungeon.name: S.P.U
TheDungeon.description: AI-driven game where you judge souls and decide their fates.
TheDungeon.about:
In this AI-powered simulation game, you step into the role of a cosmic judge tasked with deciding the fates of newly departed souls. 
Using only your intuition and the stories shared by these AI-generated souls, you’ll uncover their regrets, desires, and deepest truths. 
Every decision—whether to Save, Reincarnate, or Damn—will challenge your morality and shape their ultimate destiny. 
Can you navigate this moral maze and pass fair judgment in the Soul Processing Unit?

AboutSection.title: About me
AboutSection.d0: I am David Rojas, a Software Developer with 2+ years of experience in backend development and artificial intelligence.
AboutSection.d1: With a strong passion for learning and building complex solutions, I take a self-taught and hands-on approach to enhance my technical skills.
AboutSection.d2: I’m known for being analytical, persistent, and focused on solving real problems through technology.
AboutSection.d3: I enjoy working on innovative, high-impact projects, always aiming to deliver clean, scalable and maintainable code.

SkillsSection.Docker: Packages apps in secure containers for easy, consistent deployment.

SkillsSection.DotNet: Framework for building business-grade apps and enterprise solutions.
SkillsSection.n8n: AI-powered automation with intelligent agents for next-level workflows.
SkillsSection.OpenAI: AI models and APIs for automation, chatbots, and smart apps.
SkillsSection.React: Tool for building fast, dynamic web apps (like this one!).

FAQ.subtitle: Personal questions to reflect on and practice for interviews.
FAQ.a01: My programming journey began in 2021, driven by my interest in video games. I started with basic web development courses and bootcamps, and consolidated my enthusiasm by collaborating on the translations of the "War Report for Clash of Clans" application. This experience reinforced my decision to pursue a career in programming.
FAQ.a02: Currently, I am in the second semester of the Game Development career, with a particular focus on computer graphics and backend. My goal is to collaborate with people who share similar interests, inspire others and contribute positively to the world through technology. I am 19 years old, but I am already dedicated to continuous learning and looking for opportunities to improve and collaborate on meaningful projects.
FAQ.a11: I have always been fascinated by transforming abstract ideas into practical solutions through programming, a field where technique merges with creativity.
FAQ.a12: My early fascination with games and their development has led me to dedicate myself to software creation, where I find deep satisfaction in developing technological solutions that meet specific needs.
FAQ.a13: The constant evolution of technology offers unique opportunities to contribute to innovative projects, and I deeply value the collaborative nature of the developer community, which not only enriches my continuous learning but also strengthens connections with generous and supportive colleagues.
FAQ.a21: I specialize in backend development, although I also have the ability to work on frontend when necessary.
FAQ.a22: I particularly enjoy server-side development, where I tackle complex problems with a focus on efficiency and security. Database management, API design and maintenance, and continuous performance improvement are aspects that are crucial, as they contribute to the creation of robust and scalable applications.
FAQ.q3: Where do you See Yourself in 5 Years?
FAQ.a31: In five years, I envision becoming an expert in backend and game development, leading high-performing teams, while mentoring others. I aim to drive the advancement of revolutionary technologies and make a significant impact that inspires through innovation and collaborative efforts.
FAQ.a32: On a personal level, the aim is to maintain a healthy balance between professional and personal life, enjoying hobbies and participating in innovative projects that positively impact society. The overarching goal is to continue learning, growing, and collaborating with individuals who are passionate about technology.
FAQ.q4: What are you Looking for in a New Job?
FAQ.a41: I am looking for a collaborative environment where I can work alongside competent and committed professionals.
FAQ.a42: I am interested in participating in projects that make the most of my skills and knowledge. I especially value places that promote personal and professional growth, backed by effective communication and strong mutual support.
FAQ.a43: I am excited to take on new challenges and responsibilities in an environment that favors continuous learning and professional evolution.
FAQ.a61: To stay up to date on the latest trends and technologies, I follow influential channels such as Midudev, Fireship, Unreal Engine and Unity.
FAQ.a62: Likewise, I explore trending repositories on GitHub and participate in technology discussions on Discord and Reddit.
FAQ.a71: In my free time, I love embarking on new technological projects and collaborating on various creative initiatives. I enjoy staying active through running and hiking, as well as immersing myself in the narrative and mechanics of indie games.
FAQ.a72: At the age of 15, I actively participated in the Rocket League trading market, and making a profit with each trade, I accumulated more than 40,000 credits (400 USD). This success allowed me to buy the game Grand Theft Auto V via a gift card. Unfortunately, trading was eliminated, marking the end of a golden era.
FAQ.a73: Although those days are gone, I was left with an invaluable skill: knowing when to walk away with a profit... and a lot of good memories of those crazy trades.
FAQ.q9: The most innovative project you have worked on and why you consider it innovative?
FAQ.a91: Definitely, the creation of the Mercadix application is one of the most innovative projects I have done.
FAQ.a92: This solution addresses a recurring problem among Mercado Libre users in Argentina: uncertainty about the real value of products in a volatile economic context.
FAQ.a93: Today, Mercadix understands its users and helps hundreds of them make informed decisions about their purchases and sales, offering a strategic perspective of the market.
FAQ.q10: A moment when you had to solve a complex problem and how you approached it?
FAQ.a101: During the development of this portfolio, I faced the challenge of manually translating all the content into English, which was cumbersome and tedious.
FAQ.a102: Thanks to Santiago Ariel's guidance, I learned how to implement translations using i18next and JSON, which allowed me to reach new audiences efficiently.
FAQ.q11: A time when you had to learn something new quickly?
FAQ.a111: I wanted to develop an API to capture real-time dollar prices in Argentina. At the beginning, the process seemed complicated, but with Python, FASTAPI and an intense dedication to study the relevant documentation, I managed to build it successfully.
FAQ.a112: This API, called ArgentoFX, accomplishes in just 200 lines of Python what other projects accomplish in thousands.
FAQ.a113: It is currently consumed by my other project, Mercadix.
FAQ.q12: Projects you would like to do in the future?
FAQ.a121: A complex neural network to perform simulations in graphics engines.
FAQ.a122: A fuel price APIs and related to Argentina.
FAQ.a123: A website in the format of a virtual bookstore, where users can share books, portfolios, and more.
FAQ.a124: A remote control car game in Unreal Engine.
FAQ.a125: An in-house game engine, in DX12.
FAQ.a127: An application published on the Play Store.
FAQ.q13: A time when you supported or trained another person on your team to improve their performance?
FAQ.a131: During a game jam hosted by my current university, a teammate was not sure how to implement a certain functionality with Unreal Engine scripting.
FAQ.a132: I showed him several key functionalities, recommended useful resources and together we reviewed his code. In the end, we managed to successfully finish the game on time.
FAQ.a141: I would like to express my deep gratitude to Colin Schmale, Javier Andres Solarte, and Enzo Notario, who have been instrumental in my career for their valuable advice and constant support.
FAQ.a142: I also thank my teammates at the University and the users of several Spanish programming Discord servers, whose willingness to help and share their knowledge has been crucial for my professional development.
FAQ.a143: Lastly, I want to thank Lucas Pope, Markus Persson, and Charlie Cleveland for their inspiring work in the game development industry, which has also been a huge motivation for me to pursue a career in this field. And of course, my favorite game: Rocket League (and its magnificent soundtrack).
FAQ.a144: Inspired by these examples, I aspire to offer the same level of support and guidance to others, perpetuating the culture of collaboration and mutual learning.
FAQ.a151: A selection that will make you dance like a cyborg with an excess of caffeine.
FAQ.thanks: Thank you so much for visiting my website!
FAQ.contact: If you are interested in collaborating on a project, hiring me or just want to say hello, feel free to contact me through my social networks or by sending me an email. You can find the links in the footer below.
FAQ.a161: Rocket League, Subnautica, RDR2 and indies in general.

Initiatives.title: Other initiatives
Initiatives.subtitle: Projects and contributions made to learn new technologies and refine my skills.
Initiatives.hcr: Recreation in Unity with improvements in physics, interface and sound for a more challenging and immersive experience. Inspired by my love for this childhood game.
Initiatives.arrayutils: Functions adapted from the C++ Standard Template Library (STL) for arrays in Unreal Engine Blueprints, with over 12k downloads.
Initiatives.tgcp: Fast, ONNX-Optimized Transformer for Real-Time Character-Level Text Generation.
Initiatives.pd: Driving simulator set in a gothic city with PlayStation 2-style graphics.
Initiatives.afx: Real-time foreign exchange rates API for the Argentinean market.
Initiatives.uepc: Command line script that optimizes the maintenance of Unreal Engine projects by deleting temporary folders effectively, securely and quickly.
Initiatives.roadmapsh: As a top contributor for the 6th most starred repository on GitHub, I have made significant contributions to the project, especially in the game developer and backend roadmaps.
Initiatives.mercadix: Website that allows users to check product prices on MercadoLibre and visualize them in a histogram.
